sequential.description: Sequential mode. This forces all network calls to be ordered in a sequential order.

enableSelfMonitoring.description: Enables or disables self monitoring signals. E.g. job duration metrics.

namespace.description: Forces a specific namespace for connectors that perform namespace auto-detection (Advanced).

disable.description: If true, disables the alerting system

http.description: Configures the HTTP protocol to access the host.

username.description: Sets the username used to establish the connection with the host through the HTTP protocol.

password.description: Sets the password used to establish the connection with the host through the HTTP protocol.

timeout.description: Sets how long until the HTTP request times out (Default: 120s).

https.description: Enables HTTPS to access the host (Default: true).

port.description: Sets the HTTPS port number used to perform HTTP requests (Default: 443).

ipmi.description: Configures the IPMI protocol to access the host.

username.description: Sets the username used to establish the connection with the host through the IPMI protocol.

password.description: Sets the username used to establish the connection with the host through the IPMI protocol.

timeout.description: Sets how long until the IPMI request times out (Default: 120s).

bmcKey.description: BMC Key used to establish the connection with the host through the IPMI protocol.

osCommand.description: Configures the OS Command protocol to access the host.

timeout.description: Sets how long until the local OS Command times out (Default: 120s).

useSudo.description: Sets if sudo needs to be used for the local OS Command (Default: false).

useSudoCommands.description: Sets the list of commands for which sudo is required.

sudoCommand.description: Sets the sudo command to be used for the host to be monitored (Default: sudo).

ping.description: Configures the Ping protocol to access the host.

timeout.description: Sets how long until the ping times out (Default: 5s).

snmp.description: Configures the SNMP protocol to access the host.

version.description: Sets the version of the SNMP protocol (Default: v1).

community.description: Sets the SNMP Community string to use to perform queries (Default: public).

timeout.description: Sets how long until the SNMP request times out (Default: 120s).

port.description: Sets the SNMP port number used to perform SNMP queries (Default: 161).

snmpv3.description: Configures the SNMPv3 protocol to access the host.

username.description: Sets the username to use for performing the SNMPv3 query.

password.description: Sets the password to use for performing the SNMPv3 query.

privacyPassword.description: Sets the privacy password to use for performing the SNMPv3 query.

timeout.description: Sets how long until the SNMPv3 request times out (Default: 120s).

port.description: Sets the SNMP port number used to perform SNMP queries (Default: 161).

authType.description: Sets the SNMPv3 authentication type. (MD5, SHA or NO_AUTH).

privacy.description: Sets the SNMPv3 encryption type. (AES, DES or none).

ssh.description: Configures the SSH protocol to access the host.

username.description: Sets the username to use for performing the SSH query.

password.description: Sets the password to use for performing the SSH query.

timeout.description: Sets how long until the command times out (Default: 120s).

sudoCommand.description: Sets the sudo command to be used.

useSudo.description: Sets if sudo needs to be used for the SSH Command (Default: false).

useSudoCommands.description: Sets the list of commands for which sudo is required.

privateKey.description: Sets the private Key File to use to establish the connection to the host through the SSH protocol.

wbem.description: Configures the WBEM protocol to access the host.

password.description: Sets the password used to establish the connection with the host through the WBEM protocol.

port.description: Sets the HTTPS port number used to perform WBEM queries (Default: 5989 for HTTPS or 5988 for HTTP).

protocol.description: Sets the protocol used to access the host (Default: https).

timeout.description: Sets how long until the WBEM request times out (Default: 120s).

username.description: Sets the username used to establish the connection with the host through the WBEM protocol.

winrm.description: Configures the WinRM protocol to access the host.

password.description: Sets the password used to establish the connection with the host through the WinRM protocol.

port.description: Sets the HTTPS port number used to perform WinRM queries (Default: 5989 for HTTPS or 5988 for HTTP).

protocol.description: Sets the protocol used to access the host (Default: https).

timeout.description: Sets how long until the WinRM request times out (Default: 120s).

username.description: Sets the username used to establish the connection with the host through the WinRM protocol.

wmi.description: Configures the WMI protocol to access the host.

password.description: Sets the password used to establish the connection with the host through the WMI protocol.

timeout.description: Sets how long until the WMI request times out (Default: 120s).

username.description: Sets the username used to establish the connection with the host through the WMI protocol.

timeout.description: How long until the SQL query times out (Default: 120s).

username.description: Name used to authenticate against the database.

password.description: Password used to authenticate against the database.

url.description: The JDBC connection URL to access the database.

type.description: The type of database (e.g., postgresql, oracle, mssql, informix, h2, mysql).

port.description: The port number used to connect to the database.

database.description: The name of the database instance to connect to on the server.

uses.description: Specifies the connector ID to use. Defaults to the key name if not specified.

force.description: Set to false for auto-detection only, defaults to true if not specified.

additionalConnectors.description: Custom connector configurations keyed by their ID including variables (Advanced).

connectors.description: Sets the Connector(s) to use or exclude, as well as connector tags to be matched.

defaultRightLine.description: Line Used If No Matches From Right Table

tables.description: The list of tables to be used in the internal database query (SQL)

source.description: Source to be used as a table

stateSetCompression.description: Represents the possible compression methods for the state set metrics.

monitorFilters.description: Monitor inclusion or exclusion in data collection. This parameter accepts '+<monitor_name>' for inclusion and '!<monitor_name>' for exclusion.

items.description: Each value can optionally start with '+' or '!' followed by a valid monitor type.

collectPeriod.description: Sets the collect period that MetricsHub uses to collects metrics from the monitored resources (Default: 2m).

jobTimeout.description: Sets how long until the job times out (Default: 5m).

hostname.description: The hostname to which the query is sent.

retryIntervals.description: An array of retry intervals (in milliseconds) between request retries.

items.description: A retry interval in milliseconds. Must be a non-negative integer.

discoveryCycle.description: Sets the cycle that MetricsHub uses to perform discoveries and detect new components in your monitored environment. By default, MetricsHub runs a discovery after 30 collects.

disable.description: If true, disables the alerting system

commandLine.description: Overrides the OpenTelemetry Collector command line.

environment.description: Configures the OpenTelemetry Collector environment variables.

output.description: Configures where to print the OpenTelemetry Collector's output (Default: log).

workingDir.description: Configures the working directory of the OpenTelemetry Collector.

otel.exporter.otlp.logs.protocol.description: Property used to configure the transport protocol to use on OTLP log requests

otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.protocol.description: Property used to configure the transport protocol to use on OTLP metric requests

otel.exporter.otlp.logs.endpoint.description: Property used to configure the OTLP logs endpoint to connect to. Must be a URL with a scheme of either http or https based on the use of TLS

otel.exporter.otlp.endpoint.description: Property used to configure the OTLP traces, metrics, and logs endpoint to connect to

otel.exporter.otlp.certificate.description: Property used to configure the path to the file containing trusted certificates

otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.endpoint.description: Property used to configure the OTLP metrics endpoint to connect to

otel.exporter.otlp.metrics.certificate.description: Property used to configure the path to the file containing trusted certificates to use when verifying an OTLP metric server's TLS credentials

otel.exporter.otlp.protocol.description: The transport protocol to use on OTLP trace, metric, and log requests

otel.exporter.otlp.logs.certificate.description: Property used to configure the path to the file containing trusted certificates to use when verifying an OTLP log server's TLS credentials

otel.logs.exporter.description: Property used to configure the OpenTelemetry exporter for logs

otel.metrics.exporter.description: Property used to configure the OpenTelemetry exporter for metrics

disable.description: If true, disables the alerting system

product.description: The name of the product the license is for.

organization.description: The name of the organization the license is for.

expiresOn.description: The expiration date of the license in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

resources.description: The maximum number of resources the license covers.

patchDirectory.description: The path of the custom connectors directory, connectors will also be loaded from the default directory.
